intro: Rhodanthe pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf chatham bell, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It is an erect perennial with narrow, linear leaves and produces numerous small, daisy-like blooms. Rhodanthe pygmaea is often found in the Chatham Islands and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance.
